title: the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the consent of the Minister for
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Supplementary Welfare Allowance) (Amendment) (No. 3) (Assessment of 
Means) Regulations 2024. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Supplementary 
Welfare Allowance) Regulations 2007 to 2024 shall be construed together as one 
and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Supplementary 
Welfare Allowance) Regulations 2007 to 2024. 

Commencement

2. These Regulations come into operation on 1 August 2024.

in paragraph

and

Innovation and Science’s Student 
Accommodation Assistance Fund, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 6th September, 2024.

(df) any amount up to a maximum of €7,000.00 per annum from 
payments made by Co-operative Housing Ireland’s Scholarship 
Programme,”. 

The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform consents to the foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 August, 2024. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 August, 2024. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection.

title: the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the consent of the Minister for
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide that scholarship payments to a maximum of 
€7,000.00 per annum paid by either by the Department of Further and Higher 
Education, Research, Innovation and Science’s Student Accommodation 
Assistance Fund or Co-operative Housing Ireland’s Scholarship Programme to 
a person will be disregarded in the means test for supplementary welfare 
allowance payments. The two means disregards are inserted as new paragraphs 
(de) and (df) in article 36 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Supplementary 
Welfare Allowance) Regulations 2007. 

For correct punctuation, these Regulations also substitute a comma for a full stop 
in paragraph (dd) of article 36. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [434] 5
